metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4552 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Roundcube Webmail before 1.2.0allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the hrefattribute in an area tag in an e-mail message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4552` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

roundcube - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-core - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-mysql - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-pgsql - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-plugins - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-sqlite3 - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: roundcube package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.6+dfsg.1-1').
